name: StompyVR
description:
Want to ride in the belly of a robot as it stomps through the countryside?  

This is a VR experience where you are trapped in a robot as it consumes your life energy to feed its insatiable appetite for stomping endlessly!

Who would design such a monstrosity?  How will you escape?

SPOILER:  YOU NEVER WILL!

It's not a game, just an experience.  So you get to ride around in that robot as it stomps by some landscape.  I've thrown in a bit of "variety" in the sights so you don't get too bored on your trip.

The music was included in a free asset I used so I threw it in and actually fell in love with it during my testing.  In fact, the stomps sometimes hit at just the right spot.  I find it soothing.   Minimal.  Lovely.

If this WAS a real game the cage would be an escape room.  Just as you were stepping through your escape you'd be gaining access to different parts of the robot and you would start to control just enough of it to have to worry about crashing it.

Eventually you would gain full  control and could opt for first (cockpit) or third person and go fight the other stompers.

But this was just an "experiment" while I took a break from my main game, a third-person open-world VR game.  SMALL open world.  More like open area... No announcements on that baby, yet!   

I hope you all enjoy having your life force sapped away the longer you watch the countryside in StompyVR!

This VR experience is tested on the headsets I have:  Rift and Vive

Note to Vive users:  It starts the Vive up too high.  Press V to pop down to Player height.  Sorry about that!
